alert.note: Alert for Durham; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham and Orange. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Carrboro, Parkwood, Bethesda, Eno River State Park, Gorman, Jordan Lake and Falls Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
